meanings.definition: To retire or become eligible for retirement from a job or position due to reaching a certain age or length of service.
meanings.sent1: After many years of hard work, he is superannuating from his job next month.
meanings.sent2: She will be superannuating from her position as a teacher after turning sixty-five.
meanings.sent3: The old clock in the office is superannuating, finally getting a break from ticking all day.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be superannuating behind the horizon, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out engine was superannuating, ready to rest after years of service.

meanings.definition: To set aside or allocate funds for retirement or pension purposes.
meanings.sent1: They are superannuating a portion of their income each month for their retirement.
meanings.sent2: It is important to start superannuating money early to ensure financial security in old age.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank on the shelf is superannuating coins for a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: The wise squirrel was superannuating nuts for the winter, preparing for the cold months ahead.
meanings.sent5: The company is superannuating a percentage of profits for employee pensions.
